title: Strikes attributed to Israel destroy Iranian consulate building in Damascus
summary: General Mohammad Reza Zahedi, a senior commander in the Iranian Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) Quds force, was killed. Israel has not claimed responsibility for this unprecedented attack on an Iranian diplomatic building in Syria.

title: Gaza: Four foreign aid workers and their Palestinian driver killed by air strike
summary: According to the Hamas Ministry of Health, the four victims, including a Briton, an Australian and a Pole, were working for the American NGO World Central Kitchen.

title: New Scottish law against incitement to hatred causes great concern
summary: J. K. Rowling, the author of the Harry Potter series, has already received online threats of prosecution under the new law, which protects sexual orientation and transgender identity.

title: Kara Swisher: America's most feared tech journalist takes on Silicon Valley
summary: Since the 1990s, journalist Kara Swisher has reigned over the big tech mecca, where she knows all the secrets. In 'Burn Book,' released to great fanfare on February 27, she takes on the tech giants with the biting wit for which she is renowned.

title: Netanyahu vows to ban Al Jazeera broadcasts in Israel
summary: This Israeli prime minister vowed to shut down the 'terrorist channel,' which Israel has regularly targeted since the start of the war in Gaza, after a vote passed 70-to-10 granting him the authority to ban their broadcasts and close their offices in his country.

title: Brady Brandwood, the lobster whisperer
summary: In the seafood section of his local supermarket, this American fell in love with Leon. Since then, he's been inundating YouTube with videos documenting the pet crustacean's new dream life.

title: Germany recalls soccer jerseys with number 44 due to associations with Nazi symbols
summary: The two fours together coupled with the font on the jerseys resembled the stylized SS used by the Nazi Party's Schutzstaffel group.

title: Google to delete billions of private browsing data to settle lawsuit
summary: The lawsuit, filed in a California court, claimed Google's practices had infringed on users' privacy by intentionally deceiving them with the incognito option.

title: Germans celebrate legalization of recreational cannabis
summary: As of Monday, April 1, recreational cannabis consumption is now legal for adults in Germany.

title: Florida Supreme Court paves way for 6-week abortion ban
summary: The existing 15-week ban impacts few as most abortions occur earlier, but a 6-week limit could significantly affect abortion access in Florida and the broader south of the United States.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'Not forcing Israel to respect international law is to be complicit in genocide'
summary: Raji Sourani, lawyer and director of the Palestinian Center for Human Rights, assesses the role and limits of the international justice system to affect the war devastating Gaza.

title: Léon Marchand, the 'serial swimmer' sweeping the NCAA swimming finals
summary: Winning the 400-yard individual medley, his signature race, in Indianapolis on Friday, the 21-year-old French athlete has impressed with his versatility. This season, he has focused on his freestyle swimming and has already begun collecting records.

title: The Arizona Republican who stood up to Donald Trump
summary: Rusty Bowers, the former speaker of the Arizona House of Representatives, opposed attempts by Trump supporters in 2020 to overturn the presidential election. He continues to be the target of malicious acts.

title: Turkey's local elections: Sweeping victory for the opposition is stinging defeat for Erdogan
summary: The Republican People's Party was the big winner in Sunday's vote. It gained ground in the major cities it already held, including Istanbul, Ankara and Izmir, and took strongholds from Erdogan's AKP in the Black Sea region and Anatolia.

title: Pakistan court suspends Imran Khan and wife's graft sentences
summary: The former prime minister has been tangled in more than 200 legal cases since he was ousted in April 2022, in what he said was a campaign to keep him from power. He remains jailed on two other cases including treason and illegal marriage.

title: In Jerusalem, tens of thousands of demonstrators demand Netanyahu's resignation
summary: The Israeli prime minister is accused of prolonging the war and stalling negotiations with Hamas over the release of the hostages in order to stay in power.

title: Off the coast of Colombia, the San José shipwreck and its coveted gold
summary: A Spanish ship sunk by the English in 1708 lies 600 meters deep off Cartagena. Its valuable cargo is whetting both passion and fights.

title: Delhi chief minister moved to jail for two weeks
summary: Opposition parties say it is part of a crackdown by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government ahead of national elections later this month.

title: Paris 2024: Transport almost ready for the Olympics
summary: Paris region mobility officials are issuing more reassuring updates about key transport sites for the Games, highlighting that the event has significantly accelerated infrastructure developments.

title: Japan: Former admiral appointed head of controversial Yasukuni shrine
summary: This choice comes in the context of the country's rearmament policy and efforts to 'renationalize' a Shinto shrine associated with the country's imperialism.

title: Félix Tshisekedi, president of the DRC: 'Rwanda is not the only one responsible for the Congo's misfortunes'
summary: With the M23 rebels continuing to advance in the Democratic Republic of the Congo's east, the Congolese president has criticized Rwanda's involvement in the conflict and the international community's complicity in letting it happen.

title: Trump posts $175 million bond in New York fraud case
summary: The payment halts the collection of the more than $454 million he owes and prevents the state from seizing his assets to satisfy the debt while he appeals.

title: Swiss ministers give up free skiing
summary: Federal advisers enjoy a complimentary lift pass for all the country's ski lifts. This perk has become controversial and difficult to defend amidst an increasingly tense political climate in the Confederation.

title: 'A bell is the voice of God': The Paccard family's art of bell-making since 1796
summary: On the shores of Lake Annecy in eastern France, the Paccard family manufactures France's oldest bells, supplying churches all over the world.

title: Postpartum depression: Studies show that fathers suffer too
summary: Psychiatrists have begun to identify the psychological difficulties experienced by men around the birth of their child. According to a French study, 5% of fathers are affected.

title: Our best addresses for raisin bread
summary: With blond or brown raisins, rum or Madagascar vanilla pastry cream, abundant filling or crispy puff pastry... Where in France can you enjoy a delicious raisin bread?

title: The best places to stay, eat, drink and see in Nice
summary: To visit the city on the French Riviera without getting lost or stumbling into tourist traps, Le Monde journalists selected 20 top addresses.

title: France wants to avoid rift with Senegal's newly elected president Faye
summary: Bassirou Diomaye Faye, the country's youngest-ever leader, has said he wants to put Senegal first but pursue a constructive relationship with the former colonial nation.

title: Tehran faces strategic dilemma after Damascus consulate is targeted by strikes attributed to Israel
summary: Iran, which has so far avoided open conflict with Israel, could be forced to retaliate, raising fears of escalation.

title: Wisconsin's 'Gaza generation' wants to send Biden a warning
summary: The White House's support for Israel in its war in Gaza could lead many Wisconsin voters to abstain in Tuesday's Democratic primary.

title: Erdogan's resounding defeat in Turkey's local elections
summary: For the first time since it came to power, the AKP is no longer the country's leading party, but its second largest. Its historic rival, the nationalist Republican People's Party, now controls dozens of cities.

title: 12-year-old opens fire in Finnish school injuring three children
summary: Police said that the attacker was in custody and 'all those involved in the shooting incident are minors.'

title: Disappearance of 2-year-old French boy still a mystery after nine months
summary: The discovery of bones belonging to Emile, missing since July 2023, may have put an end to months of questions regarding his fate but has not lifted the veil on the circumstances of his death.

title: Three killed in avalanche near Swiss resort of Zermatt
summary: An American teenager and two other people were killed in an avalanche near the Swiss resort of Zermatt, police said on Tuesday. One person was flown to a hospital with serious injuries.

title: Senegal new president urges 'more solidarity' in Africa
summary: Bassirou Diomaye Faye, the country's youngest president was sworn in on Tuesday after sweeping to a first-round victory on a pledge of radical reform 10 days after he was released from prison.

title: Israeli troops leave Al-Shifa Hospital in ruins
summary: Gaza's largest hospital was ravaged by intense fighting between Palestinian militants and the IDF after the Israeli military's two-week raid.

title: French foreign minister focuses on cultural ties with China amid diplomatic divergences
summary: Stéphane Séjourné inaugurated an exhibition on Versailles and the Forbidden City in Beijing, but thorny issues such as the war in Ukraine and electric cars are complicating relations.

title: Istanbul apartment block fire leaves at least 29 dead
summary: The blaze had broken out during construction work in the first and second floors below ground, which housed a nightclub.

title: Channel crossings are on the rise
summary: More than 4,600 migrants have reached the UK by small boats since the beginning of 2024. With the onset of spring, police are worried that crossings will intensify.

title: Why the UK's minimum wage is being called the 'most successful policy of a generation'
summary: The UK minimum wage, celebrating 25 years since it was first introduced in the country, has gradually risen with no negative impact on employment.

title: Maryse Condé, prolific Guadeloupean writer, dies aged 90
summary: The Caribbean 'giant of literature,' who examined the Black diaspora throughout her vast writing career, died at the age of 90 on Monday.

title: Art Basel in Hong Kong opened its arms to 'New Gen' collectors
summary: Hong Kong's major international contemporary art fair, which closed on Saturday, returned to pre-pandemic figures. The market's resilience is attributed to new Asian collectors, who are often young, wealthy and enthusiastic.

title: Turkey: Tensions rise after ruling invalidating pro-Kurdish mayoral candidate victory
summary: During the nationwide municipal elections held on Sunday, March 31, Abdullah Zeydan from the Democratic Party (DEM) secured over 55 percent of the vote in Van, a city located on Lake Van approximately 80 kilometers (50 miles) from Turkey's eastern border with Iran.

title: European elections: European socialists rally behind the notably discreet Nicolas Schmit
summary: The Luxembourgish Commissioner hopes that his group in the Strasbourg Parliament will slow its decline in the upcoming elections, scheduled to take place from June 6 to 9.

title: Tesla sales tumble nearly 9%, most in 4 years
summary: The auto company sales come against the backdrop of a slowing market for electric vehicles in the US. Its numbers also dragged down shares of its US EV competitors, with Rivian's stock dropping 5.2% and Lucid's falling 3.5%.

title: Largest fresh egg producer in US found bird flu in chickens
summary: Mississippi-based Cal-Maine Foods, Inc. said in a statement that approximately 1.6 million laying hens and 337,000 pullets were destroyed after avian influenza was found at their Texas facility.
